title: How to Achieve Your Goals: A Guide to Practical Ideation, Will and Action
first_phrase: In this text, the author discusses the process of turning ideas into actions through practical ideation and action, where the correct mental set-up is crucial. In the last 200 tokens, the author compares a human being to an aircraft and explains that the set-up is even more fundamental than the engine. The superiority of a person with a specific goal is determined by their capacity not to lose sight of what they are doing. The author emphasizes that the first cause of failure lies in dispersion and forgetting good intentions, making it crucial to be well-settled in choices and thoughts. Lastly, the author suggests that those who achieve success are those who are strong-willed and acquainted with what they want.
content: the strength to pursue a specific path without ever deflecting from it, save insofar as any such temporary deviation might shorten the distance that separates him from his goal. The first cause of failure lies in dispersion and forgetting one’s good intentions. It is accordingly important to be well settled in one’s choices and thoughts. Surely, the only ideal which we do not become oblivious to is the ideal that is originated in the depth of our innermost being and is connected to it, as that is the ideal allowing us to openly express ourselves and be in harmonious unison with the world we belong to. Whoever is firmly entrenched in this sense is he to whom fortune offers every thing that might be encompassed by desire. Will Those men who achieve some form of success are those who are acquainted with what they need, and consequently move forward along this methodological path. They never lose recollection of what they want, nor do they ever forget to question themselves every step of the way. They are those individuals who are thus labelled by their fellow humans as “strong-willed” men.
last_phrase: In conclusion, staying focused on our goals and being firmly established in our choices and thoughts is crucial to achieving success. Our willpower is only valuable if we have a specific purpose and pursue it with unwavering determination. Let us keep our innermost ideals close and let them guide us towards harmonious unison with the world.
